Event.name: Short_selling
Event.definition:
<def-root>Short selling, a common financial market concept, involves an <fen>Intermediary</fen> selling <fen>Assets</fen> to the <fen>Market</fen>, having borrowed these <fen>Assets</fen> from a (generally implicit) <fen>Lender</fen>. The <fen>Intermediary</fen> is obligated to rebuy the <fen>Assets</fen> later, so that they may be returned to the <fen>Lender</fen>. The <fen>Intermediary</fen>'s intent is to repurchase the <fen>Assets</fen> from the <fen>Market</fen> at a lower price than when he sold them, and so return them to the <fen>Lender</fen> for a profit. <ex></ex> Because this strategy only makes sense when the <fen>Intermediary</fen> believes that the value of the <fen>Assets</fen> is lower than the valuation assigned by other members of the market, words of this frame may be used metaphorically to refer to an Agent (usually wrongly) believing some Entity is worth less than other people do.
<ex><fex name="Intermediary">He</fex> was <t>selling</t> <t>short</t> <fex name="Assets">shares</fex> <fex name="Lender">from his brother's company</fex> <fex name="Market">on the NASDAQ</fex> and he made a fortune.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Lender
Arg.definition: <def-root>The original owner and soon to be <fen>Lender</fen> of the <fen>Assets</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Intermediary
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that is the borrower to the <fen>Lender</fen> and the seller and later repurchaser to the <fen>Market</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Market
Arg.definition: <def-root>The aggregate selling place of many types of financial stocks, bond, securities, etc. The <fen>Market</fen> is also a metonym for the people who buy the <fen>Assets</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The situation that the <fen>Intermediary</fen> wishes to bring about by short selling. Because this concept is associated with finance, the <fen>Purpose</fen> is normally to earn a profit.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time at which the <fen>Intermediary</fen> engages in short selling.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place at which the short selling occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Intermediary</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Means by which an <fen>Intermediary</fen> acts intentionally. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: sell short.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: the intermediary profits from selling stocks high and buy them back lower then he/she bought them.
